main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were sighted near Indialantic, Florida on June 18, 1954 and June 17, 1954.
interesting points: The objects were described as circular, about 1/4 the size of the full moon, and accompanied by a string of smaller lights.
The objects were observed to be approximately 100 yards offshore, with light flashes lasting around 4 seconds and recurring at 10 minute intervals.
An Air Force air police squadron member sighted a glowing light in the sky that descended vertically at an extremely fast rate before disappearing abruptly.
A jet pilot from the 10th Fighter Bomber Squadron observed a bright, shiny, circular object that descended rapidly from an altitude of 35,000-40,000 feet to 32,000 feet.
The objects were described as bright, shiny, and reflecting the sun, with a definite outline and no apparent aerodynamic features.
sighted object: circular objects with string of smaller lights, glowing lights, bright shiny circular object
location: Indialantic, Florida; Patrick Air Force Base, Florida
witnesses: civilian employees, Air Force air police, jet pilot and observer
